title: Buffing Cho'Gath's numbers won't give him what he needs.
body:
Even after patch 7.6, where Riot increased Cho'Gath's health gain per stack and increased the number of stacks he could gain by feasting on minions and monsters, his win rate hasn't really changed. Why do you think that is?

It boils down to 2 main things:

1. He is an immobile champion. Sure he has all kinds of CC, but being immobile has a huge price even if you build him full tank. Most popular and successful champions in League have high mobility, frequent-use gap closers, or dodge moves. Cho has none of these things. Ultimately if a teamfight shifts, he finds himself stuck behind everyone else in an advance or retreat. He can peel fairly well against enemies who are pursuing, however he suffers tremendously when trying to predict enemy movement in a standard poke scenario.

2. Reliability of his abilities. This partially coincides with point 1, but trying to land Rupture or Feral Scream against the most played champions in League today is much more difficult than it used to be. Granted, the reward (hard cc combined with a slow and a silence) are valuable, but he pays a heavy price for missing those abilities, which frankly are too easy to dodge. 

Ultimately, he won't see more play or greater success until some reliability is put back into his kit. The Feral Scream changes many patches ago ripped away the only reliable ability he had (I'm not saying it wasn't necessary). But if Riot really wants to address his low win rate, they need to focus more on his reliability and less on pure stats.

A cone of silence stops helps stop people with mobility from getting away. A cone of slow would be near useless because they're still going to dash away from Q.

Cho gets free, constant dps from his current E. It costs no mana and happens every auto. In addition by switching it to his passive you make it so it ranks up by level instead of by rank. Do not argue that he could still do as much damage with it, that would be broken and unhealthy gameplay. In addition to fucking the mana cost on his clear speed you've also taken away his mana sustain and health sustain by removing his old passive.

Furthermore Cho has a very large melee true damage nuke. If Cho get's in melee range of a carry they're probably dead. So what good is a melee silence going to do for him? Nothing. His ranged silence helps him get into range by stopping people from dashing or blinking away (therefore stopping them from dashing out of his Q). Cho can get a slow on W by buying a Rylais, so we can add lowering itemization choices to the list of reasons why it's bad.

Your change butchers his early game, and provides no more reliability. He loses a ranged aoe silence, sustain and the option of early wave-clear (since as a passive he can't rank vorpal spikes up first). In return he gains an aoe slow and a melee silence. 

Does that really sound like a reliability buff to you? Or a buff at all in fact?

So aoe circle all around cho for his silence. His q either needs to be faster - made at a time with few high mobility champs so it had fair counterplay then, but not now where 1/5 the champs just walk out even if you throw a perfect one on an unslowed target. Alternative is to make his q more like sion q - but to have it unique, maybe make it like a wave with it rippling out to a certain distance in 3 successive pieces - starting by cho and "rolling" outwards. Enemies can either back off, or dodge forward to a section the wave has passed through to avoid getting hit. I think having this but not making it have a cast time like sion q would be really cool and improve it's usefulness.

It's not fun for him to have unreliable spells he can never afford to miss. Also his mana being reliant on his passive sucks because it makes him even worse vs lane bullies who already are amazing against him because he's an immobile melee character.

"unreliable spells that he can't afford to miss" is the heart of the issue. It is one thing to just be unreliable (Sion Q). It has a low mana cost but does a lot of damage if you manage to hit someone with a fully empowered swing. Cho loses most lane match ups because if he is forced to burn spells against an aggressive (perhaps mana-less) opponent, he runs oom very quickly.

It didnt completely fix Cho, but it keeps him relevant against most champs until he gets a complete VGU.  It used to be that he either had to go full AP to deal damage, and so he would be squishy, especially if he lost his stacks.  Or he would go tank, and would be an unreliable CC bot.

Now he can go tank or AP and still be tanky and have damage because of the health scaling on his ult and the lack of feast/famine on his ult stacks.
Frankly I think the ultimate changes made him much better. He's more threatening when building heavy tank, and he doesn't have to play scared all the time since the stacks aren't lost
I don't deny that he is better than he was, but I doubt he is at the point where Riot and the playerbase are content.

I think they ought to do a tear down rework of Cho starting from his current ult and work from there. I wouldn't give him any real mobility, since that doesn't seem his style (he's *THE* lumbering, world-devouring void monster of doom after all). However, I think they should give him some more reliable CC, e.g. something PBAoE, instant/nearly instant and relatively weak a la Volibear. I also think they should make his utility and CC abilities relate to his stacks in some way *other* than the obvious "more stacks equals higher range" idea.

I also think that changing him to be more of a peel focused tank that excels at staying alive for ages for the sake of keeping enemies off of his allies is the ideal route, and instead of a silence I feel a fear would be more appropriate.
